Solutions of this equation are the Scorer functions and can be found by the method of variation of parameters (§1.13(iii)).

The general solution is given by w(z)=Aw_{1}(z)+Bw_{2}(z)+p(z), where A and B are arbitrary constants, w_{1}(z) and w_{2}(z) are any two linearly independent solutions of Airy’s equation (9.2.1), and p(z) is any particular solution of (9.12.1).

Standard particular solutions are -\mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right), ,\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right), ,e^{\mp 2\pi i/3}\mathrm{Hi}\left(ze^{\mp 2\pi i/3}\right), , where \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)=\mathrm{Bi}\left(z\right)\int_{z}^{\infty}\mathrm{Ai }\left(t\right)\mathrm{d}t+\mathrm{Ai}\left(z\right)\int_{0}^{z}\mathrm{Bi} \left(t\right)\mathrm{d}t, \mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)=\mathrm{Bi}\left(z\right)\int_{-\infty}^{z}\mathrm{ Ai}\left(t\right)\mathrm{d}t-\mathrm{Ai}\left(z\right)\int_{-\infty}^{z} \mathrm{Bi}\left(t\right)\mathrm{d}t.
\mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right) and \mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right) are entire functions of z.
See Figures 9.12.1 and 9.12.2.

\mathrm{Gi}\left(0\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Hi}\left(0\right)=\tfrac{1}{3} \mathrm{Bi}\left(0\right)={1\Big{/}\!\left(3^{7/6}\Gamma\left(\tfrac{2}{3} \right)\right)=0.20497\;55424\ldots, }, \mathrm{Gi}'\left(0\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Hi}'\left(0\right)=\tfrac{1}{3} \mathrm{Bi}'\left(0\right)=1\Big{/}\left(3^{5/6}\Gamma\left(\tfrac{1}{3}\right )\right)=0.14942\;94524\ldots.
-\mathrm{Gi}\left(x\right) is a numerically satisfactory companion to the complementary functions \mathrm{Ai}\left(x\right) and \mathrm{Bi}\left(x\right) on the interval 0\leq x<\infty.
\mathrm{Hi}\left(x\right) is a numerically satisfactory companion to \mathrm{Ai}\left(x\right) and \mathrm{Bi}\left(x\right) on the interval -\infty<x\leq 0.

In \mathbb{C} , numerically satisfactory sets of solutions are given by -\mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Ai}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Bi}\left(z\right), if |\operatorname{ph}z|\leq\tfrac{1}{3}\pi, \mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Ai}\left(ze^{-2\pi i/3}\right),\mathrm{Ai} \left(ze^{2\pi i/3}\right), if |\operatorname{ph}\left(-z\right)|\leq\tfrac{2}{3}\pi, and e^{\mp 2\pi i/3}\mathrm{Hi}\left(ze^{\mp 2\pi i/3}\right),\mathrm{Ai}\left(z \right),\mathrm{Ai}\left(ze^{\pm 2\pi i/3}\right), if -\pi\leq\pm\operatorname{ph}z\leq\tfrac{1}{3}\pi.

\mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)+\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)=\mathrm{Bi}\left(z\right), \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}e^{\pi i/3}\mathrm{Hi}\left(ze^{-2\pi i/ 3}\right)+\tfrac{1}{2}e^{-\pi i/3}\mathrm{Hi}\left(ze^{2\pi i/3}\right), \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)=e^{\mp\pi i/3}\mathrm{Hi}\left(ze^{\pm 2\pi i/3} \right)\pm i\mathrm{Ai}\left(z\right), \mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)=e^{\pm 2\pi i/3}\mathrm{Hi}\left(ze^{\pm 2\pi i/3} \right)+2e^{\mp\pi i/6}\mathrm{Ai}\left(ze^{\mp 2\pi i/3}\right).

\mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)=\frac{3^{-2/3}}{\pi}\*\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\cos\left( \frac{2k-1}{3}\pi\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{k+1}{3}\right)\frac{(3^{1/3}z)^{k}}{ k!}, \mathrm{Gi}'\left(z\right)=\frac{3^{-1/3}}{\pi}\*\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\cos\left( \frac{2k+1}{3}\pi\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{k+2}{3}\right)\frac{(3^{1/3}z)^{k}}{ k!}.

\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)=\frac{3^{-2/3}}{\pi}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\Gamma\left( \frac{k+1}{3}\right)\frac{(3^{1/3}z)^{k}}{k!} , \mathrm{Hi}'\left(z\right)=\frac{3^{-1/3}}{\pi}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\Gamma\left( \frac{k+2}{3}\right)\frac{(3^{1/3}z)^{k}}{k!}.
\mathrm{Gi}\left(x\right)=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\infty}\sin\left(\tfrac{1}{3} t^{3}+xt\right)\mathrm{d}t, if x\in\mathbb{R}.

\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\infty}\exp\left(-\tfrac{1}{3 }t^{3}+zt\right)\mathrm{d}t, \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)=-\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\infty}\exp\left(-\tfrac{1}{ 3}t^{3}-\tfrac{1}{2}zt\right)\cos\left(\tfrac{1}{2}\sqrt{3}zt+\tfrac{2}{3}\pi \right)\mathrm{d}t.

If \zeta=\tfrac{2}{3}z^{3/2} or \tfrac{2}{3}x^{3/2} , and K_{1/3} is the modified Bessel function (§10.25(ii)), then \mathrm{Hi}\left(-z\right)=\frac{4z^{2}}{3^{3/2}\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{\infty}\frac {K_{1/3}\left(t\right)}{\zeta^{2}+t^{2}}\mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}z|<\tfrac{1}{3}\pi, , \mathrm{Gi}\left(x\right)=\frac{4x^{2}}{3^{3/2}\pi^{2}}\pvint_{0}^{\infty} \frac{K_{1/3}\left(t\right)}{\zeta^{2}-t^{2}}\mathrm{d}t, if x>0, where the last integral is a Cauchy principal value (§1.4(v)).

\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)=\frac{3^{-2/3}}{2\pi^{2}i}\int_{-i\infty}^{i\infty} \Gamma\left(\tfrac{1}{3}+\tfrac{1}{3}t\right)\Gamma\left(-t\right)(3^{1/3}e^{ \pi i}z)^{t}\mathrm{d}t, where the integration contour separates the poles of \Gamma\left(\tfrac{1}{3}+\tfrac{1}{3}t\right) from those of \Gamma\left(-t\right).

As z\to\infty , and with \delta denoting an arbitrary small positive constant, \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right)\sim\frac{1}{\pi z}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(3k)!}{k! (3z^{3})^{k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}z|\leq\tfrac{1}{3}\pi-\delta, \mathrm{Gi}'\left(z\right)\sim-\frac{1}{\pi z^{2}}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(3k +1)!}{k!(3z^{3})^{k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}z|\leq\tfrac{1}{3}\pi-\delta.

\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)\sim-\frac{1}{\pi z}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(3k)!}{k !(3z^{3})^{k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}\left(-z\right)|\leq\tfrac{2}{3}\pi-\delta, \mathrm{Hi}'\left(z\right)\sim\frac{1}{\pi z^{2}}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(3k+ 1)!}{k!(3z^{3})^{k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}\left(-z\right)|\leq\tfrac{2}{3}\pi-\delta.
For other phase ranges combine these results with the connection formulas (9.12.11)–(9.12.14) and the asymptotic expansions given in §9.7.
For example, with the notation of §9.7(i).

\mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right)\sim-\frac{1}{\pi z}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(3k)!}{k !(3z^{3})^{k}}+\frac{e^{\zeta}}{\sqrt{\pi}z^{1/4}}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{u_{ k}}{\zeta^{k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}z|\leq\pi-\delta.

\int_{0}^{z}\mathrm{Gi}\left(t\right)\mathrm{d}t\sim\frac{1}{\pi}\ln z+\frac{2 \gamma+\ln 3}{3\pi}-\frac{1}{\pi}\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\frac{(3k-1)!}{k!(3z^{3})^ {k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}z|\leq\tfrac{1}{3}\pi-\delta.

\int_{0}^{z}\mathrm{Hi}\left(-t\right)\mathrm{d}t\sim\frac{1}{\pi}\ln z+\frac{ 2\gamma+\ln 3}{3\pi}+\frac{1}{\pi}\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}(-1)^{k-1}\frac{(3k-1)!}{ k!(3z^{3})^{k}}, if |\operatorname{ph}z|\leq\tfrac{2}{3}\pi-\delta, where \gamma is Euler’s constant (§5.2(ii)).
All zeros, real or complex, of \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right) and \mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right) are simple.
Neither \mathrm{Hi}\left(z\right) nor \mathrm{Hi}'\left(z\right) has real zeros.
\mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right) has no nonnegative real zeros and \mathrm{Gi}'\left(z\right) has exactly one nonnegative real zero, given by z=0.60907\;54170\;7\ldot s.
Both \mathrm{Gi}\left(z\right) and \mathrm{Gi}'\left(z\right) have an infinity of negative real zeros, and they are interlaced.

For the above properties and further results, including the distribution of complex zeros, asymptotic approximations for the numerically large real or complex zeros, and numerical tables see Gil et al. (2003c).
For graphical illustration of the real zeros see Figures 9.12.1 and 9.12.2.
